duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop, implement, and validate utilization and cost models that characterize providers' claims submissions and treatment patterns.
Maintain integrity of databases and repositories. Collect data for ad-hoc request reports and documentation.
Prepare compensation reports and actuarial requests for compensation comparisons and analysis.
Review and prepare reports, compile statistics, and analyze data regarding dentists requesting changes to their compensation.
Coordinate collection of internal data to facilitate investigation of irregularities by dentists, enrollees, or other external entities.
Assist with onsite investigations into cases of suspected fraud or misrepresentation involving providers, brokers, clients, or enrollees.
Keep abreast of network infrastructure and leverage data sets needed to meet business requirements.
Review profiling parameters for statistical validity and recommend adjustments.
Support Client Acceptance Testing of approved business applications and provide input to improve reliability and accuracy of data.
Troubleshoot and suggest improvements to systems and software applications.
Build, develop, and test applicability of new utilization models based on claims data.
Serve as a technical resource to division employees. Coordinate with all other Enterprise areas when applicable.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree or equivalent education preferred. Minimum 3 years' experience in business, data collection/coordination, and analysis in areas of investigation and/or claims review processing.
